required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Clinical Evaluation of Acetabular Cup Placement in Total Hip Replacements Utilizing a Pelvic Alignment Level (PAL) Instrument

brief_summary.textblock: The study is conducted to evaluate the performance of the Pelvic Alignment Level (PAL) instrument in achieving desired acetabular position, desired leg length and offset after Total Hip Replacement (THR) reconstruction.

detailed_description.textblock: Total hip replacement (THR) has been a sucessful treatment for cases of degenerative joint diseases. However, post operative complications such as dislocations, osteolysis, component wear and migration are still a concern. It has been noted in the scientific literature that precise acetabular cup position helps reduce such post operative complications. The Pelvic Alignment Level (PAL) offers this solution by assessing pelvic motion and optimizing implant position without the need for intra-operative fluoroscopy or a large capital expenditure. The focus of this study is to evaluate the clinical outcomes (acetabular cup placement, femoral offset, and leg length) of using the PAL instrument to those without using PAL instrument during total hip replacement. This will be a prospective, post market, randomized multi-center clinical study.

primary_outcome.measure: To Evaluate the Surgical Accuracy in Placing Acetabular Components at a Target of 45° Inclination and 20° Anteversion While Using the PAL Compared to Surgeries Without Using the PAL Instrument.

secondary_outcome.measure: To Evaluate the Surgical Success of Achieving Preoperative Targets for Leg Length and Femoral Offset, or be Able to Document Changes to Pre-operative Leg Length and Offset, Using the PAL Compared to Surgeries Without Using the PAL Instrument.

arm_group.description: No Pelvic Alignment Level Instrument Used

intervention.description: No Pelvic Alignment Level Instrument Used

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient has signed an IRB approved, evaluation specific Informed Patient Consent Form.
- Patient is a male or non-pregnant female age 18 years or older at time of enrollment.
- Patient clinically qualifies for total hip arthroplastic surgery, based on physical examination and medical history.
- Patient must have a diagnosis of: osteoarthritis, traumatic arthritis, avascular necrosis, slipped capital epiphysis, pelvic fracture, failed fracture fixation or rheumatoid arthritis.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient's anatomy precludes a cup placement of 45° inclination and 20° anteversion.
- Patient has an active infection within the affected hip joint.
- Patient is a prisoner.
- Patient has plans to relocate to another geographic area before the completion of the evaluation.

group.title: PAL (Pelvic Alignment Level)
group.description: The cases randomized into the "PAL Group" will have total hip replacement surgery performed utilizing the PAL instrument. Pelvic Alignment Level (PAL) Instrument: Total hip replacement surgery will be performed utilizing the PAL Instrument.

group.title: No PAL (No Pelvic Alignment Level)
group.description: The cases randomized into the "No PAL Group" will have total hip replacement surgery performed without the use of the PAL instrument. This group will serve as the control group. Total Hip Replacement: Total hip replacement surgery will be performed without utilizing the PAL Instrument.

group.title: PAL (Pelvic Alignment Level)

Total Hip Replacement: Total hip replacement surgery will be performed without utilizing the PAL Instrument.

outcome.title: To Evaluate the Surgical Accuracy in Placing Acetabular Components at a Target of 45° Inclination and 20° Anteversion While Using the PAL Compared to Surgeries Without Using the PAL Instrument.
outcome.population: The study was terminated early, therefore, primary or secondary measures were not assessed.

reported_events.desc: Industry Standard Adverse Event (AE) terms (e.g. MedDRA) were not used for AE data collection. Specific AE terms were not used for all AEs collected.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: To publish, exhibit or lecture, the manuscript, exhibit or speech must be provided to Stryker at least 60 days prior to submission for publication or presentation. The Investigator must receive consent from Stryker prior to publication, exhibition, or disclosure of scientific and clinical data. This review by Stryker is not intended to curtail distribution of scientific and clinical data, but to identify and edit any company confidential material and/or violations of FDA and FTC regulations.
